DOCNAME: MOURA CARREIRA and MARGARIDA LOURENCO CARREIRA v. PORTUGAL
TEXT: The applicants [ Mr PERSON and PERSON ] are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE ( GPE ) . They were represented before the ORG by PERSON , of ORG . ] are NORP nationals
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG issued a temporary injunction prohibiting the applicants from disposing of their shares in a private limited company , PERSON . , following an application for this protective measure ( providência cautelar ) by ORG , who were also members of the company . ORG had alleged that the applicants had failed to honour a promise to sell shares to them .

On DATE the applicants lodged an application to have that decision set aside ( embargos ) . They alleged , inter alia , that the document produced by GPE , containing the promise to sell the shares , was a forgery .
In an order of CARDINAL DATE , which was served on the applicants on DATE , the court invited them to bring interlocutory proceedings to challenge the authenticity of the document in question .

The applicants appealed against that order to ORG ) , but the outcome of the proceedings is not known . However , they also made an interlocutory application on DATE challenging the authenticity of the document , as the court had invited them to do .
In an order of CARDINAL DATE the court ruled that it could not entertain the application as it had been made out of time .
The applicants appealed against that order to ORG , which in a judgment of DATE quashed the impugned decision .

The case was remitted to ORG . On DATE that court decided that the proceedings to set aside the protective measure should be stayed pending the outcome of the proceedings to challenge the authenticity of the document .
In a judgment of DATE the court dismissed the interlocutory application . That decision was upheld by ORG in a judgment of DATE .

In a decision of CARDINAL DATE ORG permanently stayed the proceedings to set aside the protective measure , in the light of the decision taken in the main proceedings ( see below ) . The applicants were also ordered to pay costs and expenses .
The applicants appealed against that decision , but only in relation to the costs order . In a judgment of DATE ORG allowed the appeal and made an order for costs against GPE
On DATE PERSON and GPE brought an action for damages in LOC in respect of the applicants’ alleged failure to honour their promise to sell shares in PERSON .
In a judgment of DATE the court dismissed their claim .
ORG appealed to ORG . However , since they failed to file pleadings , the court declared the appeal invalid ( deserto ) in a decision of DATE . That decision was served on the applicants on DATE .

At the time when the proceedings in question were instituted , applications to set aside protective measures were governed by LAW . In such applications complainants could challenge the proceedings whereby a protective measure had been ordered by adducing evidence capable of casting doubt on the grounds for the measure or of curtailing its scope ( see LAW and LAW in the version applicable at the time , and ORG judgments of DATE , Boletim do PERSON ( “ ORG ” ) no . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL , and DATE , ORG no . CARDINAL , p. CARDINAL ) .

Under LAW , a protective measure ceases to have effect if the claims of the party in whose favour it was made are dismissed in the main proceedings . In that event , the court must permanently stay the proceedings in respect of the protective measure ( LAW ) .
